Description: Weight: quarter-qisṭ. Eight line Kufic inscription. Made of olive-green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4026 – OA+ 4029. From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 122; Miles, G.C. 1951. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps: a supplement’. New York, 11; Dudzus, Wolfgang. 1961. Frühe Umayyadische Glasstempel aus Ägypten mit Beamtennamen in den Berliner Museen. ‘Staatliche Museen zu Berlin’ 3-4. Berlin, 6d; Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (II. Peter Ruthven collection). New York, 15; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 188. Cf. Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 69-72; Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 61; 1971, 16; Balog 1976, 182-7, 189.

Once again the date is cramped: ‘tisʿ’ (nine) begins with three rather than four 'teeth'. A large portion of pieces with Muslim's name are olive-green rather than the more usual green or bluish green.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (95)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Muslim b. al-'Arrāf
